Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Stations under North Central Railways to.description: ALLAHABAD: In a major initiative for disposing and recycling garbage in near future, authorities of North Central Railways (NCR) is mulling over the proposal to install proximity sensor based audio playing equipment to separate bio degradable and non-biodegradable waste. General manager, NCR, Rajiv Chaudhry, while chairing a compliance meeting of National Green Tribunal, on Friday, suggested that installing such sensors can be tried out near public dustbins for better awareness among passengers. “Garbage collection bags should be bio-degradable and of separate colours and CCTVs should be installed at stations to check cleaning activity,” the GM said. It was informed that about 10 stations including Allahabad and Kanpur are already covered under CCTV and work for 20 more stations is underway. Likewise, provision of more bottle crushing machines for major stations would be made. It was informed that procurement for about 20 machines covering six stations has already started. He also emphasised to have anti-litter display in all coaches of NCR and added that NCR will also undertake campaign against open defecation over railway areas and tracks. “The discussion about provision of more toilets on stations and circulating area also took place during the meeting. It was also informed during the meeting that all 1,300 coaches of NCR shall be equipped with bio toilets within this year,” informed NCR, CPRO, Ajit Kumar Singh. Chaudhry informed in the meeting that massive plantation drive with the help of forest department is being undertaken. A MoU has already been signed and plantation will start with first rains expected around June 20. He also said that the automatic coach washing plant should be installed to save water. It was said that the automatic coach washing plant for Kanpur and Agra Cantt has already been sanctioned and it is expected to get installed within this financial year. “We should use technology, innovation, mechanization to conserve water and there should be monthly progress monitoring of these important components regarding compliance of NGT directives,” said the GM. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.
